description: Conversion of a section of public toilet into a cafe
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the preperation or cooking of any hot food, a scheme for the extraction and dispersal of all fumes and odours arising from the development (including details of its method of construction, odour control measures, noise levels, its appearance and its finish) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and then implemented in full. The measures which form the approved scheme shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No customers shall be served on / at the premises hereby permitted before 07:00 or after 21:00 on any day.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of nearby residential occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012

Prior to the commencement of the use hereby permitted, details of refuse storage and recycling facilities and a refuse collection strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These approved facilities/details shall be implemented prior to the commencement of the approved use and shall be retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No extract fans, louvres, ducts or other internal or external plant shall be installed without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties and the visual amenities of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Details of the proposed gravel surfacing shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the implementation of this part of the development. This approved surfacing shall be implemented in accordance with these approved details, prior to the commencement of the approved use, and therefore retained as such. Reason: To ensure that the proposed surfacing is appropriate in retaining the openess of the site in compliance with Policy DM5 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and/or re-enacting that Order) and Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act (As Amended) the premises shall only be used for the purposes listed below and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class (E) of Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 or any provision equivalent to that Class in any Statutory Instrument revoking and/or re-enacting that Order).Use Class E(a) for the display or retail sale of goods, other than hot food (other than ancillary sales), principally to visiting members of the publicReason: To protect the amenities of the occupants of nearby buildings and land. Only the above use contained within Use Class E has been assessed, no evidence has been submitted to demonstrate that the other uses contained within Use Class E would be acceptable in this location.
